alert.note: Alert for Ozaukee; Washington (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:23PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ozaukee, northeastern Washington and southern Sheboygan Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Random Lake, or 10 miles east of Kewaskum, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oostburg, Belgium, Cedar Grove, Random Lake, Cascade, Adell, Waldo, Silver Creek, Beechwood, Fillmore, Boltonville, Harrington Beach St Park, Gibbsville, Batavia, and Hingham. This includes Interstate 43 between mile markers 107 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
